fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation, External Relations, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
EU Digital Single Market strategy 
EU Single Market Strategy 
Market access (including ongoing FTA negotiations) 
Vertical restrictions and related guidelines (selective distribution) 
Intellectual property (trademarks, customs enforcement, IPRED, trade secrets, illegal content online, ...)
organisation_name: European Cultural and Creative Industries Alliance (ECCIA)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: ECCIA is composed of the five major European Cultural and Creative Luxury Industry associations: Circulo Fortuny (SP), Comité Colbert (FR), Fondazione Altagamma (IT), Walpole (UK) and Meisterkreis (DE). Its members represent together approximately 300 of Europe's leading luxury brands covering 14 different high-end product and service markets. The aim of ECCIA is to promote the interest of the European high-end industries towards the European Institutions.
